<td class="editors_note" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding: 0px 40px 16px 40px; border-left: 2px solid #353535; border-right: 2px solid #353535; border-bottom: 2px solid #353535; border-collapse: collapse; border-radius: 0px 0px 10px 10px;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Good morning. </strong>If magazines can have a spiffy cover...why can't email? </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">That was our thinking behind the visual that welcomes you to Sunday Edition. Each week, we work with talented illustrators on a special cover image that captures general "vibes." As you can tell from this week's illustration by <a href="https://www.instagram.com/tsjissetalsma/?hl=en" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tsjisse Talsma</a>, we have a lot of spring cleaning to take care of today. Previous Sunday Editions featured illustrations from <a href="https://markwangillustration.com/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mark Wang</a> and <a href="https://www.instagram.com/katedehler/?hl=en" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Kate Dehler</a>. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">If you enjoy these artists' work, be sure to show them some love on social media—they'll definitely appreciate it. At the very least, we hope this inspires you to break out the colored pencils for a Sunday doodling sesh.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500">-Neal</p>
</div>

<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Icebreakers With... Bridget Connelly
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/16/icebreakers-withbridget-connelly" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bridget Connelly, Founder of Luna Bay Booch, drinking Luna Bay's hard kombucha" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzU3L2JyaWRnZXRfY29ubmVsbHkucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Luna Bay Booch</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Bridget Connelly is originally from Chicago, but after college she moved to California, then Texas, then Uganda, then back to Chicago, then to Australia in search of something she could really get behind. It wasn't until she found herself in San Diego, a hub for hard kombucha and craft beer, that she had the idea to start <a href="https://lunabaybooch.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Luna Bay Booch</a> and enlisted her business partner and childhood friend, Claire Ridge, to help.  </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Luna Bay was "born in Chicago" and is the first woman-founded-and-led hard kombucha brand on the market. Most of Connelly's team is new to the alcohol industry, but their focus on wellness, the planet, and building a community around a drink is setting them apart.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">We asked Connelly some icebreakers and inquired about her plans to transform the alcohol industry.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What's a question that you wish someone would ask you about your job?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“What are the things that light you up?” When I hear from my team about how much they love what they do and they're excited about what they're doing every day, it brings me so much joy.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What has your experience as a women-led brand in the alcohol market looked like?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In the beginning, it was hard to be taken seriously. And luckily, we are very strong-willed, smart women and did our research in the space. I do think it's changing. We are really fortunate that we have amazing distributors that are empowering us and really want to support [women-led] brands.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What is the worst piece of advice you've ever gotten about running a business?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">"You signed up for this." At first, I would take that personally because I <em>did</em> sign up for this. So I thought I had to keep pushing myself to limits that were super unhealthy. You don't have to carry the weight of the world on your shoulders.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What song would you say describes Luna Bay?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“Night Moves” by Bob Seger is definitely a Luna Bay song.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What are you reading right now?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><a href="https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/258507/when-breath-becomes-air-by-paul-kalanithi/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>When Breath Becomes Air</em></a>. It's an amazing book. I was recently thinking about rereading it. And when I passed it at the airport last week, I was like, that's a sign.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What's your favorite flavor of Luna Bay?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Ginger Lemon right now, [although] I go through phases. I also love mezcal. So I love making a ginger lemon mezcal Booch-a-Rita. Our new flavor is coming out in June. I can't say what it is yet, but I can't wait for everyone else to try it.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>This interview was lightly edited and condensed for clarity.</em></p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse" width="100%">
<tr>
<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px">

WORK LIFE

<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Chasing Down Receipts
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/16/make-work-chasing-receipts" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Make It Work logo" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em></em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Each week, Morning Brew's Head of People Ops Kate Noel answers <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reader-submitted questions</a> about work in 2021. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>I'm a bookkeeper and my colleagues constantly ignore my pleas for receipts. What's the best way to get them to take my requests seriously?—Kelly in Philadelphia</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Kelly...I feel you on this one. Countless times I've seen my brothers and sisters over on the accounting side of the room deal with this very problem. Chasing people to submit receipts...ain't nobody got time for that! </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">So here's what I would do. Talk to your manager about installing a policy that says if employees do not submit a receipt to support a purchase within 60 days, they will not receive reimbursement. If the issue is an employee using a corporate card and not providing receipts for purchases, then their individual card can be blocked for 30 days if they make several purchases without proof of receipt. It's a hard stance, but I am sure once this policy is circulated and enforced, folks will get their ish together.  </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Should I feel guilty about taking time off after only being in my new job for three months?—Anonymous</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I don't think that you "should" feel guilty about requesting time off with just three months under your belt. When an employee requests time off, the request must always honor the company's general PTO policy. If your company's PTO rules don't have a probationary period, then I don't see a problem.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I would also assume that before you can take a single day off you would have to make that request to your manager. Managers are the gatekeepers of the company policies. Your manager has to make a judgment every time a direct report makes a PTO request. That's to make sure there is no negative impact on the business and its scheduling needs. So go ahead, sip on your mojito at the pool with shades on, and if a hater has something to say...tell 'em to take it up with your boss.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Something bothering you at work? </em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23486973.16825/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77C474a70d2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23486973.16825/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77C474a70d2&source=gmail&ust=1618690043221000&usg=AFQjCNFhq3Yo_tCcY0k_cH9IVYOJNziaiQ" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Ask Kate for advice here</em></a><em>.</em></p>

<tr>

</a><span> </span>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;color: #353535; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 22px; table-layout: auto; width: 100%; border: none;" width="100%">
<tr>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffe62e 25%, #0f9046); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">
 
</div>
</td>
<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border: 2px solid #353535; background: white; margin: 0px; padding: 10px;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">
ANALYSIS
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">
 
</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Should the Government Have Paused the J&J Vaccine?
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/16/government-paused-jj-vaccine" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="vaccine clock" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzU5L3ZhY2NpbmVfY2xvY2suanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em></em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">This week, the US' surprisingly smooth vaccine rollout hit some turbulence, and regulators turned on the seatbelt sign. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">On Monday, the CDC and FDA recommended <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/13/us-regulators-recommend-pause-johnson-johnson-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pausing</a> Johnson & Johnson's single-dose Covid vaccine while they investigate reports of rare blood clots. And when we say rare, we mean six women were found to have developed blood clots out of the roughly 7 million people who had received the vaccine. One died. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Because of the country's bountiful supply of Pfizer and Moderna vaccines, the decision isn't likely to significantly slow the rollout. But it did lead to heated discussions around people's appetite for risk, crisis communications, and trust in experts. </p>
<h2 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">The argument against a pause</h2>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Agencies said they paused the rollout out of an "abundance of caution." Critics say the amount of caution used was abundant in the way the amount of mayonnaise on a Jimmy John's sandwich is abundant.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">They point to the numbers: Covid-19 has killed more than 560,000 Americans—blood clots from vaccines, 1. By pausing a vaccine that is overwhelmingly useful in fighting Covid, aren't we focusing on the wrong problem?  </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Plus, this isn't a binary choice—there might be options other than suspending the rollout to everyone. 538's Nate Silver, one of the top critics of the government's decision, <a href="https://twitter.com/NateSilver538/status/1382049439251107847?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suggested</a> that regulators could have said they're monitoring the situation and <em>not </em>paused vaccinations, or could have stopped giving J&J to young women, who appear to be most at risk of developing the rare blood clots. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Finally, US health regulators, by seeking to avoid a credibility crisis, may have just invited one in. For those hesitant to take a vaccine—and there are many—seeing the FDA pause J&J over safety concerns is leading at least some of those skeptics to go, "HA! Knew it." </p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li>
<span>A </span><span><a href="https://today.yougov.com/topics/politics/articles-reports/2021/04/15/johnson-johnson-vaccine-confidence?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=website_article&utm_campaign=johnson_johnson_vaccine_confidence&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">YouGov poll</a></span><span> found that the perception of safety of the J&J vaccine dropped 15 percentage points after officials suspended it.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzYzL3lvdWdvdl9wb2xsX29mX3BlcmNlaXZlZF92YWNjaW5lX3NhZmV0eS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<h2 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">So what were officials thinking? </h2>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Instilling confidence in vaccines is their No. 1 priority, and right now...there isn't a ton of confidence. According to a recent <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/04/14/987265125/ex-fda-chief-sees-struggle-to-vaccinate-more-than-half-u-s-population?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NPR/Marist poll</a>, 25% of Americans would refuse a vaccine if offered, which could complicate the push for herd immunity. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">As Axios's Bryan Walsh writes, vaccines are "<a href="https://www.axios.com/risk-psychology-johnson-johnson-coronavirus-vaccine-00db8999-06d2-4550-9d34-49161fae8ef2.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">virtually unique</a>" among medicines because you take them not when you're projectile vomiting, but when you're healthy. Therefore, you demand a higher level of safety from vaccines than other treatments ("I'm feeling great...why would I jeopardize that?"). </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The FDA and the CDC know this. They know J&J-induced blood clots are extremely rare, rarer than getting a blood clot from Covid or getting struck by lightning. But they made a calculated decision to pull J&J based on what they think would give a skeptical public the biggest confidence boost around vaccine safety. Early indications show they may have miscalculated. </p>

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>It’s already begun.</strong> A disruption of the $1.7 trillion art market isn’t just coming—it’s already here. Previous Sunday Editions featured illustrations from \u003ca href=\"https://markwangillustration.com/\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMark Wang\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://www.instagram.com/katedehler/?hl=en\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eKate Dehler\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIf you enjoy these artists' work, be sure to show them some love on social media—they'll definitely appreciate it. padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nIcebreakers With... Bridget Connelly\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/16/icebreakers-withbridget-connelly\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Bridget Connelly, Founder of Luna Bay Booch, drinking Luna Bay's hard kombucha\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzU3L2JyaWRnZXRfY29ubmVsbHkucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eLuna Bay Booch\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBridget Connelly is originally from Chicago, but after college she moved to California, then Texas, then Uganda, then back to Chicago, then to Australia in search of something she could really get behind. It wasn't until she found herself in San Diego, a hub for hard kombucha and craft beer, that she had the idea to start \u003ca href=\"https://lunabaybooch.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLuna Bay Booch\u003c/a\u003e and enlisted her business partner and childhood friend, Claire Ridge, to help.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eLuna Bay was \"born in Chicago\" and is the first woman-founded-and-led hard kombucha brand on the market. Most of Connelly's team is new to the alcohol industry, but their focus on wellness, the planet, and building a community around a drink is setting them apart.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWe asked Connelly some icebreakers and inquired about her plans to transform the alcohol industry.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat's a question that you wish someone would ask you about your job?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“What are the things that light you up?” When I hear from my team about how much they love what they do and they're excited about what they're doing every day, it brings me so much joy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat has your experience as a women-led brand in the alcohol market looked like?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn the beginning, it was hard to be taken seriously. And luckily, we are very strong-willed, smart women and did our research in the space. I do think it's changing. We are really fortunate that we have amazing distributors that are empowering us and really want to support [women-led] brands.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is the worst piece of advice you've ever gotten about running a business?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\"You signed up for this.\" At first, I would take that personally because I \u003cem\u003edid\u003c/em\u003e sign up for this. So I thought I had to keep pushing myself to limits that were super unhealthy. You don't have to carry the weight of the world on your shoulders.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat song would you say describes Luna Bay?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“Night Moves” by Bob Seger is definitely a Luna Bay song.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat are you reading right now?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/258507/when-breath-becomes-air-by-paul-kalanithi/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eWhen Breath Becomes Air\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. It's an amazing book. I was recently thinking about rereading it. And when I passed it at the airport last week, I was like, that's a sign.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat's your favorite flavor of Luna Bay?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eGinger Lemon right now, [although] I go through phases. I also love mezcal. So I love making a ginger lemon mezcal Booch-a-Rita. Our new flavor is coming out in June. I can't say what it is yet, but I can't wait for everyone else to try it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis interview was lightly edited and condensed for clarity.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F04%2F16%2Ficebreakers-withbridget-connelly\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Make It Work logo\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eEach week, Morning Brew's Head of People Ops Kate Noel answers \u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereader-submitted questions\u003c/a\u003e about work in 2021. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eI'm a bookkeeper and my colleagues constantly ignore my pleas for receipts. What's the best way to get them to take my requests seriously?—Kelly in Philadelphia\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eKelly...I feel you on this one. Countless times I've seen my brothers and sisters over on the accounting side of the room deal with this very problem. Chasing people to submit receipts...ain't nobody got time for that! \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eSo here's what I would do. Talk to your manager about installing a policy that says if employees do not submit a receipt to support a purchase within 60 days, they will not receive reimbursement. If the issue is an employee using a corporate card and not providing receipts for purchases, then their individual card can be blocked for 30 days if they make several purchases without proof of receipt. It's a hard stance, but I am sure once this policy is circulated and enforced, folks will get their ish together.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eShould I feel guilty about taking time off after only being in my new job for three months?—Anonymous\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI don't think that you \"should\" feel guilty about requesting time off with just three months under your belt. When an employee requests time off, the request must always honor the company's general PTO policy. If your company's PTO rules don't have a probationary period, then I don't see a problem.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI would also assume that before you can take a single day off you would have to make that request to your manager. Managers are the gatekeepers of the company policies. Your manager has to make a judgment every time a direct report makes a PTO request. That's to make sure there is no negative impact on the business and its scheduling needs. So go ahead, sip on your mojito at the pool with shades on, and if a hater has something to say...tell 'em to take it up with your boss.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSomething bothering you at work? \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23486973.16825/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77C474a70d2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23486973.16825/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77C474a70d2\u0026source=gmail\u0026ust=1618690043221000\u0026usg=AFQjCNFhq3Yo_tCcY0k_cH9IVYOJNziaiQ\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAsk Kate for advice here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F04%2F16%2Fmake-work-chasing-receipts\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;\"\u003e\n \n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003ctd class=\"column\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nShould the Government Have Paused the J\u0026J Vaccine?\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/16/government-paused-jj-vaccine\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"vaccine clock\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzU5L3ZhY2NpbmVfY2xvY2suanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThis week, the US' surprisingly smooth vaccine rollout hit some turbulence, and regulators turned on the seatbelt sign. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eOn Monday, the CDC and FDA recommended \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/13/us-regulators-recommend-pause-johnson-johnson-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epausing\u003c/a\u003e Johnson \u0026 Johnson's single-dose Covid vaccine while they investigate reports of rare blood clots. And when we say rare, we mean six women were found to have developed blood clots out of the roughly 7 million people who had received the vaccine. One died. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBecause of the country's bountiful supply of Pfizer and Moderna vaccines, the decision isn't likely to significantly slow the rollout. But it did lead to heated discussions around people's appetite for risk, crisis communications, and trust in experts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003eThe argument against a pause\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAgencies said they paused the rollout out of an \"abundance of caution.\" Critics say the amount of caution used was abundant in the way the amount of mayonnaise on a Jimmy John's sandwich is abundant.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThey point to the numbers: Covid-19 has killed more than 560,000 Americans—blood clots from vaccines, 1. By pausing a vaccine that is overwhelmingly useful in fighting Covid, aren't we focusing on the wrong problem?  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003ePlus, this isn't a binary choice—there might be options other than suspending the rollout to everyone. 538's Nate Silver, one of the top critics of the government's decision, \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/NateSilver538/status/1382049439251107847?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuggested\u003c/a\u003e that regulators could have said they're monitoring the situation and \u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003epaused vaccinations, or could have stopped giving J\u0026J to young women, who appear to be most at risk of developing the rare blood clots. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eFinally, US health regulators, by seeking to avoid a credibility crisis, may have just invited one in. For those hesitant to take a vaccine—and there are many—seeing the FDA pause J\u0026J over safety concerns is leading at least some of those skeptics to go, \"HA! Knew it.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://today.yougov.com/topics/politics/articles-reports/2021/04/15/johnson-johnson-vaccine-confidence?utm_source=twitter\u0026utm_medium=website_article\u0026utm_campaign=johnson_johnson_vaccine_confidence\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eYouGov poll\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e found that the perception of safety of the J\u0026J vaccine dropped 15 percentage points after officials suspended it.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzYzL3lvdWdvdl9wb2xsX29mX3BlcmNlaXZlZF92YWNjaW5lX3NhZmV0eS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\" data-reactroot=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003eSo what were officials thinking? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eInstilling confidence in vaccines is their No. 1 priority, and right now...there isn't a ton of confidence. According to a recent \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/04/14/987265125/ex-fda-chief-sees-struggle-to-vaccinate-more-than-half-u-s-population?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNPR/Marist poll\u003c/a\u003e, 25% of Americans would refuse a vaccine if offered, which could complicate the push for herd immunity. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAs Axios's Bryan Walsh writes, vaccines are \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/risk-psychology-johnson-johnson-coronavirus-vaccine-00db8999-06d2-4550-9d34-49161fae8ef2.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evirtually unique\u003c/a\u003e\" among medicines because you take them not when you're projectile vomiting, but when you're healthy. Therefore, you demand a higher level of safety from vaccines than other treatments (\"I'm feeling great...why would I jeopardize that?\"). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe FDA and the CDC know this. They know J\u0026J-induced blood clots are extremely rare, rarer than getting a blood clot from Covid or getting struck by lightning. But they made a calculated decision to pull J\u0026J based on what they think would give a skeptical public the biggest confidence boost around vaccine safety. Early indications show they may have miscalculated. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F04%2F16%2Fgovernment-paused-jj-vaccine\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block;
